alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 24 at 10:10AM PDT until March 25 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM PDT SATURDAY ABOVE 3500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow above 3500 feet. Additional snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades. * WHEN...Until 5 AM PDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Motorists should be prepared for winter driving conditions across the Cascade passes, especially at night and early in the morning during this multi-day event. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Lighter snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches are expected along US-97.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained for Oregon by calling 5 1 1 or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com, or for Washington by visiting online at https://wsdot.com/travel.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades
